column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Choctaw alphabet, written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. killer, murderer
  2. killing, slaughter

verb
  1. to kill, to murder
  2. to be sick or infected (usually with a skin disease)

num
  1. one

noun
  1. oneness, unity
  2. unit

adj
  1. other, another
  2. individual, particular, certain
  3. sole, only
  4. undivided

verb
  1. to be one
  2. to unify
  3. to do one

noun
  1. goodness, good
  2. excellency, excellence
  3. purity. pureness
  4. fairness
  5. safety, soundness. peace

adj
  1. good
  2. excellent, nice
  3. benevolent, kind, gracious
  4. sound, wholesome, healthful
  5. handsome
  6. delightful

verb
  1. to be good, to be excellent, to be easy
  2. (transitive) to like, to love, to delight
  3. (intransitive) to feel well, to do well
  4. (passive) improved, bettered, made good

adv
  1. finely, soundly

noun
  1. a potato hill, a hill of potatoes

pron
  1. (now chiefly Oklahoma Choctaw, archaic in Mississippi Choctaw) mine

noun
  1. something spoken
  2. language, talk, speech
  3. word, sentence, statement, saying
  4. communication, message, lecture, news
  5. law

adj
  1. oral, verbal

adv
  1. orally, verbally

pron
  1. (now chiefly Oklahoma Choctaw, archaic in Mississippi Choctaw) thine, yours

noun
  1. chipmunk
  2. a small ground squirrel

adj
  1. brindled, striped

verb
  1. to be brindled or striped

noun
  1. an ulcer, comes from the foot or the leg

noun
  1. bone
  2. stone of a fruit
  3. shell of a nut

pron
  1. (now chiefly Oklahoma Choctaw, archaic in Mississippi Choctaw) yours, you all's, y'all's

pron
  1. (now chiefly Oklahoma Choctaw, archaic in Mississippi Choctaw) ours, us many's

noun
  1. eunuch, castrated person or animal
  2. coward; an insult

column2:
noun
  1. (archaic) son

verb
  1. to hit, to strike, to beat, to bump

noun
  1. strength, nerve
  2. hardness

adj
  1. strong, sturdy
  2. hard, solid, heavy, tough

adv
  1. rigidly

verb
  1. to be strong
  2. (intransitive) to harden

noun
  1. sourness
  2. acidity

adj
  1. sour
  2. acid
  3. tart

verb
  1. to sour, to turn sour, to become sour

noun
  1. bite
  2. biter

verb
  1. (transitive) to bite
  2. to pinch with instrument, such as tongs

noun
  1. bite
  2. biter

verb
  1. (transitive) to bite
  2. to pinch with instrument, such as tongs

noun
  1. cold, coldness
  2. a cold (illness)
  3. frigidity
  4. strangeness

adj
  1. cold

verb
  1. to be cold (not the sensation)

noun
  1. (obligatory possessive) younger sibling of the same sex

noun
  1. blue
  2. green
  3. gray
  4. verdure
  5. verdigris

adj
  1. blue
  2. green
  3. gray
  4. verdant

verb
  1. (intransitive) to be green, to be blue
  2. (causative) to rust (of copper), to turn green

noun
  1. son
  2. (unmarked possessive form) his son, her son, its son, their son, of the son, of a son

pron
  1. (now chiefly Oklahoma Choctaw, archaic in Mississippi Choctaw) ours, us few's

adj
  1. dry
  2. arid
  3. hoarse
  4. mealy
  5. dried, cured, evaporated, withered

verb
  1. to dry
  2. to become dry
  3. to cure (meat)
  4. to season (of wood)
  5. to bake (of earth)
  6. to evaporate
  7. to wither

pron
  1. (distal demonstative) that, those
  2. (emphatic) he, she, it, they

det
  1. that, those
  2. (distal demonstrative, with possessed noun) his, her, its, their

adv
  1. there

intj
  1. indeed

noun
  1. Alternative version of yvnnvsh (bison), typically spoken in Mississippi.
